Abraham Lincoln to Thomas Ewing, 22 July 18491 My friendGeo. H. Holtzman, now of theDistrict of Columbia, is an applicant for a clerkship– I can not recommend himasanIllinoian; because applicants now resident here would have just cause to complain of me– Still,

               place; and while here was a good citizen, and a true and activewhig– I take it, his gentlemanly deportment, and business qualifications can not be in question, inWashington City, where I believe he is well and extensively known–2
